docs.snippet: Sterling Drug, Inc., last year increased its net profit to $13,006,961 from $12,721,610 in 1948, according to the annual report of James Hill Jr., chairman and resident, mailed to stockholders yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sterling Drug, Inc., last year increased its net profit to $13,006,961 from $12,721,610 in 1948, according to the annual report of James Hill Jr., chairman and resident, mailed to stockholders yesterday.

headline.main: NET EARNINGS RISE FOR STERLING DRUG; $3.31 a Share Compares With $3.25 in 1948, Despite First Sales Decline in 17 Years SWIFT IN REORGANIZATION International, Largest Packer in South America, Plans Change EARNINGS REPORTS OF CORPORATIONS WHEELING STEEL OUTLOOK Company Expects Production to Be at Capacity for at Least 6 Months CURTIS PUBLISHING REPORT Net of $5,185,943 Earned for 1949 Compared With $5,380,193 CANADA STEAMSHIP LINES Record Gross Reported Despite Rise in Operating Costs CREAMERIES OF AMERICA Net Income $1.55 a Share in 1949, Best Earnings Since 1946 WHITE SEWING MACHINE Net Earnings Off to $11.27 a Share Despite Increased Sales ROBERTSHAW REPORTS DIP $2,733,150 Earned Last Year Against $3,326,523 in 1948 OTHER CORPORATE REPORTS

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 28--The twelve-year-old LatinAmerican Labor Confederation (C.T.A.L.), which once dominated organized labor in South America, today renewed its bid for leadership under unmistakably Communist auspices.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 28--The twelve-year-old LatinAmerican Labor Confederation (C.T.A.L.), which once dominated organized labor in South America, today renewed its bid for leadership under unmistakably Communist auspices.
docs.abstract: debate over ratification and Communist Deputy Rodriguez opposition noted

headline.main: REDS IN AMERICAS IN NEW LABOR BID; Conference in Uruguay Seeks to Woo Former Backers, Praises Big Wool Strike

byline.original: By MILTON BRACKER Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: SHIPPING--MAILS; ALL HOURS GIVEN IN EASTERN STANDARD TIME

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, March 29 (AP)--An agreement between Argentina and Swift International--a holding company incorporated in Buenos Aires --providing for the transfer of the meat and food processing company from Argentina to the United States, was announced...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, March 29 (AP)--An agreement between Argentina and Swift International--a holding company incorporated in Buenos Aires --providing for the transfer of the meat and food processing company from Argentina to the United States, was announced today.
docs.abstract: transfer of holding co from Argentina to US as corp set; divds to be remitted

headline.main: SWIFT TO RECOVER ARGENTINE ASSETS; Lengthy Negotiation Ends With Reorganization Agreement for International Concern

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 29--Vicente Lombardo Toledano insisted today that the LatinAmerican Labor Confederation (C.T.A.L.) had a broader grip on organized labor south of the Rio Grande than the new InterAmerican Labor Confederation (C.I.T.) with...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 29--Vicente Lombardo Toledano insisted today that the LatinAmerican Labor Confederation (C.T.A.L.) had a broader grip on organized labor south of the Rio Grande than the new InterAmerican Labor Confederation (C.I.T.) with which the American Federation of Labor is associated.
docs.abstract: Lombardo Toledano sees Latin-Amer Confed gaining over AFL Inter-Amer Confed; notes lack of ties with US; denies link with Communists; Uruguay refuses visas to WFTU execs L Saillant and S Rostovsky to attend conf

headline.main: LATIN LABOR TIES WITH U.S. FOUGHT; Lombardo Toledano in C.T.A.L. Session at Montevideo Puts Stress on Bar to A.F.L.

byline.original: By MILTON BRACKER Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
